If you are looking for rich, soothing decadence, look no further. It literally tastes like a liquid snickerdoodle cookie (those sugar cookies with cinnamon baked in). My only criticism is that you need quite a bit of powder to make a flavorful cup, and it takes a moderate about of effort to make sure the powder has fully dissolved.
These are a "grandkid" favor from Pop!  Always good and fresh!! Usually don't last long around our house and in Pop's pockets!! Childhood favorites for both of us as well!
This is a great tasting but pricey coffee.  Love most of Coffee Masters flavors but this is a special favorite.

I love izze sparkling soda, they are so tasty and refreashing.  This one does not really have a blueberry taste but that is a hard flavor to mimic so for the flavor that this soda did taste like it was very nice.  It taste alot like the blackberry only more tart, I like it but pomegranate is my favorite so far from the flavores that I have tried.
Izze sparkling juices are generally pretty good.  This one, unfortunately, is not.  All I can taste in it is apple juice.

I fell in love with Stash chocolate mint tea two years ago.  I am thrilled to be able to buy it now in an economical and environmentally friendly way.  This is used for my private use and I've felt uncomfortable with all the many boxes I've gone through in order to have my six bag a day tea fix.  If you are a tea junkie and care about our landfill situation then go for broke and purchase this way and save yourself a couple of hundred bucks.

I have tried many OOlong teas and this is by far the best.  It has a wonderfully light coconut, mango flavor.  The two flavors blend well together, neither one overpowering the other.  I will definitely buy again.
really nice tea, and smells wonderful. I enjoy it with a teaspoon of "sugar in the raw."  Stores well as is wrapped in foil. I usually buy the box of 100 teabags since it is an excellent value

column9: A ginormous box of 1,000 tea bags
column10:
Stash Chamomile Herbal Tea is tea bags with dried, crushed chamomile flowers.

Honestly, as far as I'm concerned, chamomile is chamomile. I suppose that when you use loose flowers you get sediment in the cup and I have seen this happen with some brands of chamomile tea bags, these don't do that.

I have also had organic chamomile (this isn't) but I can't taste the difference.

Each bag is individually packaged and that is either good or bad depending on how and where you use it and if you are concerned about excessive packaging.

If you really, truly like chamomile tea, or own a restaurant, this ginormous box of 1,000 single-serving tea bags is a good choice.
Fast shipping. Smells good when you open the tea bag - tastes like watered down coffee with a faint mint aftertaste. Not recommended.

column9: Somewhat Bland, But A Superior Nutrient Mix.
column10:
Tonight I had a light lettuce-based salad for dinner and, to go with it, I opened up an 18.6-ounce can of Campbell's Chunky Chicken Noodle Soup (Healthy Request Variety). I thought it to be a rather bland-tasting chicken noodle soup, but that's because most chicken soups have such a high sodium content. This one is relatively low and, in fact, the potassium content is higher than the sodium content, which is almost unheard of in Campbell's soups. It's fairly low in calories also so a whole can (two servings) only amounted to 220 calories. Also, the fat content is low and the protein content is fairly high. I'm surprised they don't label this a "diet soup." Both the spiral noodles and the vegetables (carrots and celery) are fairly large and "chunky" and all seem bland and overcooked. I would not regard this soup as a particularly good one, but if you want to open a can of soup for a meal, the mix of nutrients is superior to most.

Gary Peterson

This size bag is great for filling up the office candy dishes that some offices keep around for public grazing (I'm my own best customer). Mix of candy is good, no complaints from anyone. Large enough bag that it lasts for more than a few days.  Candy was fresh (I sampled several just to make sure). Price is about what I'd pay for the equivalent amount of candy if I went to the local grocery store.

I bought these mainly to get free shipping for a case of silken tofu. I have yet to try the tofu, but I did try the Shibolim whole wheat soup croutons in a super salad I made for dinner. I'm not big on soups as I am with salads and croutons makes for a nice topper. These being so tiny had me concerned they would get lost in my salads. They are a welcome change from the boulder croutons I usually buy. I would buy these again as they are yummy.

column9: I am nuts for corn nuts
column10:
If you've never had corn nuts the best way I can describe them is by stating that they are hard, crunchy, salty and definetly require that you eat them with a beverage. The best snack I can compare it to are the crunchy japanase peas but more dense and with a corn taste ;)

However, if this your first experience with corn nuts, I recommend the Rach flavor or original unless your into spicy. They aren't super spicy but they are tangy. I love to eat them with lime and additional chile sauce (like tapatio).

This flavor is my favorite I have tried so far - nice and spicy without being overpowering. Great price for buying these in bulk. The small bags are good to have on hand for passing out to your friends or co-workers too!

There is a definate reason these everlasting treat balls are always sold out of the big local pet food stores- they are fantastic! My dog is a very rough chewer- he can even rip apart kongs, and he loves these treat balls. They don't last him for "hours" per say as the package states, but enough time that I am able to have him busy when we have company over. It's especially helpful if you insert a treat ball in both ends of the blue ball, making it especially challenging to pop out the edible discs. Not for an everyday treat obviously, due to quantity and prices, but I will definately buy them again!

I can't tell you how Everlasting Treat Medium Vanilla Mint taste great but my dogs seem to love them and they last a long time. I got the medium for my 3 pound Chihuahua and 14 pound Chinese Crested Hairless and the size seems to suit them well.

First: If you don't have the ball holder, don't bother with these. They aren't really "everlasting" in the ball, but they'll last you a whole lot longer (for most dogs) when inserted in the StarMark Everlasting Treat Ball, Large

Second: Make sure you get the right size for your dog. If you have a giant breed, this whole line isn't really for you. My 40lbs Aussie who is a moderate chewer, is about the large ball's limit and once she pops the treat out, the remainder is gone in less than 5 minutes. If you have a tiny dog, get the right size. They aren't going to be able to handle the large. They need to be able to gnaw at it, which they won't be able to do on the larger balls.

Third: These are pretty neutral smelling, which is a plus for this line. I know dogs are all about the smell of things and the stinkier something is, the more they like them...but when you have to share the household with a dog, you need to find a happy medium. This is ours when company comes over. It has no real smell, but they aren't her favorite either.

I bought a 2-pack of the liver flavored Everlasting Treats to see if my husky/g.shepherd puppy would like them. She ate the first one in one sitting. That wasn't very "everlasting" and at nearly $4/ea it was an expensive treat. The 2nd one she took 2 - 3 days to eat, so I decided I would buy more of them as an occasional treat. My next puchase included the treat ball and a couple of other flavors (BBQ and Vanilla Mint). I put a Liver and a Vanilla Mint in the treat ball and she went LOVED the VM. It took effort this time to enjoy it, and she worked on it for over a week until there was nothing left but a disk of the treat in the treat ball (so I removed it, gave it to her, and put a new treat in the ball). The ball definitely helped a lot in slowing down the consumption time of the treat and she enjoys playing with it.

Two paws up!
My Boxer loves these treats.  Only thing is they get a little sloppy and if you have wall to wall carpet it can be very messy.  She eats it too quick and it won't stay in the toy.

I was looking for something that would keep my dog busy, but also wasn't food that he would just eat and be done with. This treat, combined with the Everlasting Treat Ball is such a great solution. My dog (about 60 lbs, Dalmation) has so much fun trying to get this out of the ball, and he seems to love the taste of the Vanilla Mint more than any others. This takes him a while to eat, but also isn't a lot of food. it's a pretty decent sized treat. When I first got it, it took him a while to get the treat all the way out, even days! Now he can do it in an hour so so, but I still think it's a great buy.

Just make sure to get the right size for your dog! Too small and they will rip it apart.

I'd have suspected that the vanilla mint wouldn't be the favorite between our four dogs, but it is! These treats fit into a variety of the everlasting treat balls. We have the large blue one that takes two 'dog hockey pucks' and two orange ones that take one each. These are about the density of bone, and are made of not particularly nutritious stuff but are excellent for cleaning teeth and giving the jaws a workout.

We have a very old, very big malamute, another pretty old pointer, a big...err...we're not sure what he is exactly, part rotty, part small bear, part cat...and a black lab puppy. Everyone loves the everlasting treats, but this is definitely the favorite followed by the barbecue/smoke one. The malamute isn't much for chew toys, but he absolutely mauls this like he was 12 years younger. Everyones teeth look considerably better after a few weeks of these treats.

I have two golden retrievers one is 10 mos old the other is 8 mos old. Every now and then I need to actually get things done, and with two goldens its quite a challenge. I like to give them their everlasting treat ball filled with the vanilla mint treat. It keeps them quite and busy for about an hour. The treats can be a little difficult to get into the ball and first, but the more you use it the easier it is. It seems like the big box pet stores and also my local supermarket do not carry these in size large. They only seems to stock small and mediums. Very convenient ordering through Amazon. If you need a little time, these work great to keep the pups occupied and they have nice breath too!

Cheryl

Our dogs love the Everlasting Vanilla Mint!  One dog will licks and the other dog chews but it takes them a long time to finish them when they are in the treat balls.  The treat ball has provided them with hours of entertainment this winter when we haven't been able to get out much.  We have tried the Chicken and Liver flavors as well but the vanilla mint is by far the favorite.
My Bulldogs love it, it dose not smell as bad as some of the other flavors.
Our Chihuahua flies through these! They are great for encouraging use of both top and bottom front teeth rather than solely the back as with many bone-type dental chews.

column9: A little too small for even my Shih Tzu & Pekinese
column10: Made my dogs breath fresh but these were a little too small for even my Shih Tzus & Pekinese - I was scared they would choke on them.  I would recommend the company not making them so small and just sticking with the medium ones.

My sister told me about these great treats for the dogs to help keep them occupied when we will be away from home for extended periods of time.
The treat may not be everlasting, but with my two German Shepard's it lasts for several hours, unlike the knuckle bones that many pet stores sell. The kongs that are designed to hold these treats are excellent as well, giving a challenge for the dog.

I am very pleased and plan to order more in the future. Quick shipments and no problems with payment or delivery.

These treats don't last, my dog can pop them out in a matter of minutes, and it's completely gone in about 5 minutes.  Add to that the seller I purchased from only sent me one (they come in packs of 2, seller opened it and only sent me one treat), I was very disappointed.  Never going to bother with these again.

Great for long lasting chewing...good on teeth. My Labradoodle, who is a very productive, super fast chewer(could compete nationally) takes about 3days to mostly diminish this treat. Many other pets(especially non-chewers who don't get enough chewing d/t non-interest in chew treats(like my poor dental health bearded collie) take much, much longer(months). Does produce a bit of a non-pleasant odor when thoroughly slimed by my voracious chewer Labradoodle.

Both of my chihuahua mutts love these inserts. I use the treat in a bendo ball for one and she's busy for hours! The other pooch doesnt like the bendo ball but loves this treat. He eats it in about 10 minutes.

Def will stock up on these. Especially seeing as the dog that likes the treat in the ball is the more demanding of entertainment than the other - who is contented by just sitting next to me and snugglling.

I just wish they were a bit less expensive, however, it's worth the price for a happy (ie. not bored) dog.

column9: Everlasting Treat for Dogs, Vanilla Mint, Large
column10: My dog seems to like these.  He will not stop until all gone.  You can smell item while he is eating it.  Would buy again but not often cause of cost and they only last him about an hour and a half.

column9: "Everlasting" is not quite a good description
column10: I have two Australian Shepherds and they love this product.  I put one in each treat ball and then fill with the small treats.  They get the treats out quickly and then start on the everlasting treat.  If by "everlasting" they mean one day, then ok.  They are agressive chewers, but I was hoping that these treats would last at least a week.  They do love the flavors and there is peace a quiet (except for the loud chewing)for one evening, anyway.  We also end up wasting the last bit of the treat as it is under the lip of the ball and they cannot get at it.  All in all, I will continue to buy this product as a special treat for them from Amazon as the cost is less than at PetSmart.

I bought this for my active dog who won't eat rawhides. I was afraid she wouldn't like the vanilla mint flavor, but it's a hit. I also put some of her daily kibble in the large everlasting treat ball StarMark Everlasting Treat Ball, Large, which keeps her active but isn't an increase in her calorie intake. Make sure you get a ball that's bigger than your dog's jaw so they can't bite the treat in half. Overall very happy with this product.

Our dogs really seem to love these, but they seem to be softer than the others so they are able to wear them down faster than the other flavors we have used.  Great product though and really keep the dogs entertained
Dogs loved it, but they freed it and ate it in minutes.  Turns out to be a dollar a minute for the dogs' enjoyment.  Might as well have been a milk bone.

column9: I Don't Know If You Could Call It "Vanilla Mint"
column10: It fits the right ball and it is just as "everlasting" as the other disks, but I really don't think this smells at all like vanilla or mint.
Does not last more than 15 min, I have a Terrier mix dog about 55 Ib It took him 5 min to eat one half of the everlasting treat. It is good treat but has nothing to do with it's name.

I bought these for my 100 lb lab/shepherd mix and the first one he got out within 5 minutes.  I takes me about 10 minutes to get the stupid things in! I have to use a screwdriver to get it in the ball.  Unless I have the time to get the large and medium ones in the toys, it's not worth the trouble.  If my lab mix can't get the treat out, he tends to give up and leave it for our smaller dog to just lick.  Wish there was an easier way to get the treats in-if anyone knows of one, please let me know!

My little dog wouldn't even lick it, she isn't going to even get close to it. Beware! She loves her treats and I was hoping after reading the other reviews that it would be good for her and her breath, but what a waste of $5. So frustrated!

Just a friendly warning, you might have to send them back.

I would consider this the best flavour of nerds. The coatings really bring out their inner flavour, and you'll want to be snacking on them all the time, which is why i ordered this 36 pack. I would suggest this to all snackers!

I have to have a box of nerds at least once a week. They really aren't that bad in terms of calories at 180 cal. for the whole box and they take a while to eat and that's always a good thing when you are watching your calories.

They taste yummy (sweet and sour) and in terms of treats, they are in my top ten for sure.

column9: l believe all of them are scrumptious!
column10:
Most of them are sour, but some sweet. These Lem-Wat ones are sour. But great. Some of the best candy I've ever devoured. My box was gone in 20 seconds. I will be getting these some time next week!

You should get some too. You will stay in the cupboards that they reside in! ^_~b

They are a classic candy that will satisfy a sweet tooth in a second.

I love them! My favorite is Lemonade - Watermelon.

MMMMMMmmmmmm!

5 stars.
I just love these Nerd candies! both flavors are doble dipped and great. the package arrived in time. would get again

column9: not the ones in the picture
column10: the nerds it describes as Wonka Nerds, Apple-Watermelon and Lemonade-Wild Cherry are not the ones in the picture. i wanted the ones in the picture witch are wild cherry and watermellon but thats not what these are. the company that is selling them has the name of the product and the pictures mixed up.
Great purchase...I will have enough nerds to last me the next six months! What a tasty candy!

Yeah, Nerds have always had a great taste, but I don't understand why the Wonka company continues to use Carmine color in their products. Carmine color, which is listed in the ingredients above, is made from the ground up bodies of the cochineal insect. So until Wonka learns that they don't need to use ground up bugs to color their candy red, I'm not buying.

Darn these taste good, but do they *really* have to make them with insects?  Should be avoided by vegans, vegetarians, persons with religious diets that restrict insect consumption, and people with insect allergies.

column9: Great vegan mints - for vegans and non-vegans!
column10: These mints are just what I've been looking for - they are strong without being overpowering, sugar-free, and contain no animal by-products.  I do wish the packaging was easier to recycle, but it is quite handy for dispensing the mints.

Thank you for your speedy reply.  I was pleased with the service. Your product was exactly what  I wanted. This is my favorite balsamic vinegar. I don't know what I would do without this product. I put it on so many of my foods, veggies, meats, noodled, pasta. It can be used on salad without any other ingredients. Delicious!

I bought a bottle of Blackberry Balsamic Vinegar last fall at a county fair, and since it is now running low, I attempted to find the brand that I had purchased at the fair, but to no avail.  When I found the Blackberry Ginger Balsamic Vinegar at Amazon, I decided to give it a try.  I was pleasantly surprised to find that it is as good as, if not better than, the old stuff.  I will definitely reorder!

I bought this product on a whim (I don't remember where) and fell in love with it. It is absolutely the best balsamic vinegar I've ever had. I use it on salads, vegetables, as a dipping sauce with olive oil, just about anything you can think of. It has a thicker consistency that most other balsamics and a very unique taste. With the closing of  Tavern on the Green, I was worried I would not be able to find it. Now that I've found it, I plan to order more!

These dried strawberries do taste good - indeed, they're addictive.  When I eat one, I usually end up eating several more.  But they're too sweet.  The sugary taste and texture of this brand of dried strawberries makes me feel like I'm eating candied strawberries.  This wasn't what I expected from the description.  I should have paid more attention to the other review that complains of over-sweetening.  Don't buy these, unless you want to eat strawberry candy; buy another brand which lets you enjoy the natural strawberry flavor and texture more.

Was looking to buy some dried strawberries when I came across this offering.

In the description it says air dried strawberries without sulphur dioxide.

In the picture shown the ingredients list sulphur dioxide!

Not saying it's good or bad but why can't they describe what they are selling accurately???

I ordered this item because I thought it was freeze-dried kinda like dehydrated, but it's not!  They taste like they were pickled and rolled in sugar!  Yuck!  The original strawberry taste is gone.  The company sent them to me very promptly and in great packaging, but I really thought it was something else...  The page does not provide a good description of what the product really is.

I wantd to make the Barefoot Contessa's recipe for strawberry scones, which calls for dried strawberries.  Expecting to get something akin to dried cranberries or raisins, I was disappointed, these should be called candied strawberries since they hardly resembled fruit and were coated in sugar.  They were OK in the recipe, but I can't feel good about feeding these to my family.  Save your money (they are pricey!)and use craisins instead - or just go for chocolate.
I don't believe these are real strawberries. I think this product is made from strawberry pulp + sugar + who knows what. They seem like slightly more healthy strawberry gummy bears candy.

I had never cooked or baked with dried strawberries until I came across a recipe for granola that I had to try, and it called for dried strawberries.  I purchased a bag of these Barry Farm strawberries, and I was so amazed by their pure flavor and soft texture that I came back for more ... and more!  Barry Farm must choose berries at their peak of ripeness because the berries are rich in pure strawberry flavor with a perfect consistency. I am particular about the food I buy, and I want good quality.  Why bother to bake something with inferior ingredients?  I would highly recommend Barry Farm Dried Strawberries to anyone.  They are truly excellent.

When I ordered these I thought they would be freeze dried strawberries that I could use in cereal or for snacking. But they are somewhat dehydrated strawberries that have been super sweetened. I will use them for baking instead. Just be aware that they are not plain dried strawberries.

We have five cats - one an elderly cat of 15 years, the other four in the 9-11 year range. The oldest cat was diagnosed a couple of months ago with the beginning stages of chronic kidney disease. His numbers didn't warrant being on prescription food yet, but we needed to start paying attention to things like protein and phosphorus levels in his food. Because we have five cats, and some of them are nibblers eating four or five nuggets at a time, we decided to switch them all to an acceptable food for the oldest, so we picked the active longevity because it specifically mentioned kidney support and calories appropriate for less active older cats.

Since we made the switch 6 weeks ago, all of the cats have gained weight. This was fine for the little old guy as he was a bit underweight; not good for the rest of them. Our other male went from a slightly chunky 18.5 lbs to an obese 21.25 lbs - almost three pounds in 6 weeks! The 3 females gained between 1.5 to 2 pounds each. We noticed them making a lot more visits to the food bowl, like they couldn't seem to get full. We also saw a lessening of coat quality - lots of shedding even though they are brushed regularly (including with a furminator) and one developed bad dandruff. The stools developed a really bad odor, although I do have to say nobody developed diarrhea which I am grateful for. Most worrisome was that the lab results on the old guy came back with some of the kidney values of concern having worsened.

I am very disgusted with Science Diet - they are actively fooling the public with the nutritional claims on the bags. One of the sites I researched on for chronic renal failure has charts detailing the nutritional breakdown of most of the various foods available. If you compare the various Science diet formulae that have different health claims on them - the nutritional values for the components listed are all within a tenth of a point or two. Basically from the nutritional analysis it appears that they are the same base formula with maybe a slight difference in a vitamin or additive. With other brands, such as innova or royal canin, there appears to be an actual difference between the different formulae.

Now to deal with the weight gain, as well as the other problems we noted, we are switching foods again. This time we are trying royal canin indoor mature. Wish us luck.

Had the pleasure of trying this while visiting my parents back east. It is really really good! Not too salty and just plain tasty!! I was bummed to realize I couldn't purchase it around Seattle so I had to order some! Once you try this I know you will be hooked and at 35 calories a cup, it's a pretty safe addiction :-) Enjoy!!
Carefull!  Although the picture shows a BOX of gum, this is PER PACK price.  Also, MyNaturalMarket's return policy does not include return $ coverage.  As for the gum itself:  great procuct.

column9: good but not what's on the picture
column10: the product itself is great but it didn't come in the packaging I expected. It's actually small individual packages. Lots of waste of paper and aluminium and not as many gum as I thought.

We've been "hooked" on Spike seasnoning for salads and fried or scrambled eggs for years. When I could no longer find it, I "Googled" it, and immediately found it at Amazon.com. I've bought several things from Amazon, and their speed, service, and security has been outstanding.  Highly recommend them .
This seasoning is good on all meats and vegetables. I ran out a couple of months ago and nothing I cooked tasted the same. You must try it.

column9: So good on Baked chicken & fish!
column10: I just started using this about 2 months ago and I love it!  It has really transformed my baked chicken from so-so to a well-seasoned, tasty dish.  When I first tried it on fish, I used too much, not realizing the sodium content.  Next time, I just adjusted accordingly, added a pat of butter and ended up with delicious tilapia.  I recommend it as a staple to your spice cabinet.

column9: Spike can be used on so many things, it's amazing!
column10: I use Spike on popcorn, veggies, meats, soups, eggs... you name it.  It is a healthier seasoning than most - and so delicious!  I am elated to know that I can now order it online, because the health food store is not always so easy to get to.

I have always used SPIKE on cottage cheese.  It's an old trick. NOW... finely chop some green onion tops, some parsley and some garlic.  Mix that into small curd Cottage Cheese, season with SPIKE. Chill.  Even great on toast. High protein and delicious!
i've loved spike especially on buttered corn, popcorn, potatoes and eggs.  i also could not find it locally anymore. thanks to the internet and amazon for making it available again.
I find that Spike is too salty for me. I like the similar product called Vegit much better, it's a little more savory and less salty than Spike. Made by the same people, too.

We have been using "original" Spike since 1989. It's great for marinating chicken, steak and pork and as a substitute for baked potatoes and corn on the cob. We use it on just about everything. The product incorporates dozens of natural ingredients and altogether create great flavor that is better than Dash and other similar products. Our guests always ask "what did you use" and have begun purchasing it for themselves. It's not easy to find at your grocery store; sometimes placed in the international section, sometimes in the spice section. We're very happy to have found it sold on Amazon.Spike Seasoning - 3 oz - Salter Flakes
Got very sad when I couldn't find this in the stores anymore. Got very happy when I could find it on Amazon. Spike is the best. :)

This is my #1 favorite condiment, but I can't find it in stores anymore -- not in health food stores and not in well-stocked supermarkets. So I bought one for the house and one for the office. Now I know where to find it the next time I'm running out.

I have used "spike" for >20 years!! It,s best on all veggies, taken the place of smoked meats, butter, and on baked potatoes spike and a little margarine is all you need. In soups, especially vegetable soup; spike is the  bomb! I used to get this seasoning at organic/vitamin stores, but now I can buy at amazon in 6 packs.
I purchased this  after watching a vegetarian recipe on YouTube. I added it to my Chilean Sea bass. Big mistake! This almost ruined my buttery, expensive fish. Perhaps it works well on meat.

column9: Excellent High Quality Seasoning with great flavor
column10:
I was introduced to this about 30 years ago as a child and I've loved it ever since.

I first had it on steaks, i've put it on fish, vegetables. I love to sprinkle it over freash steamed broccli and mow...

it's really very good...there are a ton if ingredients in it....all natural...

Spike has been an absolute fav of mine for years.  There is no comparison to enhance the flavor of all veggies.  Sprinkle and add a little olive oil for the barbie.  None of my local stores carry it anymore, so when I found it online, you bet I purchased plenty of bottles.  Good thing, too, because my friends love it, and they take a bottle with them when they leave!
My husband loves this in his tuna fish. I am not a tuna fish fan but with this seasoning now I eat tuna.

I love this product. Saw it on Dr.Oz show. Best product I ever purchase. Low sodium. I had problems with sodium and cholesterol. It has definitely help lower my cholesterol and sodium intake. I would recommend this product to everyone. I brought two and gave one to my daughter. I use it on all my food. It taste good and I use it on all my food. I do not need as much as I would if I was using actual salt to season my food.

Spike brings a fresh, natural pop! to everything from salad to eggs, steak to potatoes.  Reading the list of ingredients will convince you. Spike is a blend of natural, not laboratory, ingredients, that is a 'Must Have' in my kitchen.  Spike is my absolute favorite seasoning, bar none.
We can't find this in stores anymore in Myrtle Beach SC area; started using this several yrs ago and have loved it since.

This is my must-have spice for all my cooking.  Not hot but lots of flavor.  I wish it were easier to find and buy.  When I first purchased from Amazon, the price was competitive....now is not.  Should be less than $3.
I looked for Spike in a bunch of grocery stores to no avail  I use it a lot in cooking.  First tried it when on a long camping trip and our friends brought it.  Excellent.

Spike is my secret weapon in the kitchen.  I've been using this for 30 years. I used to have to go to the health food stores and it is harder and harder to find.  Thank goodness for Amazon. You can find anything here!!!
I received this tea for Christmas.  This tea has a great flavor and has quickly become my new favorite.
Consider purchasing a different product, this juice is contained in plastic #7, one known for BPA and is widely told to avoid, especially for babies!!!

I liked to use these for travel, just throw them in the diaper bag and go!  I don't, however, think they are economical for everyday use.  I wish they sold it in the big bottle.  Instead I just buy a different brand of organic juice to drink at home that I purchase in a larger quantity.
We just started incorporating juice in our 6 month old's diet and are trying to go organic.  She loves this product!!!

I paid 2.99 a fifteen ounce jar or roughly 9 bucks for three.  Grossly overpriced here. Avoid this ripoff and look for cheaper. Also when measured out this fifteen ounce was barely more than an eight ounce cup. The fifteen ounces are not by liquid measure but by actual weight.👎

Love this stuff.  On eggrolls or anything asian and suddenly your in you favorite chinese restaurant - or better yet, traveling somewhere near The Great Wall!  I'm so addicted to this stuff.  It's delicious and goes great with Moo-Shoo anything!  If you're a chinese food lover, you know this sauce is a MUST.  Settle for nothing less.  Love this stuff.  Sweet, salty and tangy.  Just how it should be!  ~  Yum!  ~  Oh by the way ... a little goes a long long way!

This Chai is so good.  It reminds me of powdered hot cocoa but I could also see paying 4.00 for something just like this in a coffee house!!  I love the flavor - it is a mild chai flavor.  Even though I watch my calories, I try to fit in one drink a day.  The value on amazon is outstanding!  I am on subscription and can tell I will need to move it up to a more frequent delivery increment!

column9: What a great way to start my day!
column10: I cannot start my day without this great tasting Chai drink. I have two hot cups of it every morning, its smooth, not too sweet, and soooooo tasty. I love it and will keep ordering it as long as Amazon keeps stocking it.

I am trying to find a great chai to make at home when I am not treating myself to a Starbuck's chai. I was drinking Pacific Chai (spicy) for a long time which I liked for the most part. (I made it into a vanilla chai by adding a 1/2 tsp of French Vanilla coffee-mate creamer to about a 10-oz cup of water, with 3 tbs of chai powder, while in the blender.) After a year or so, I wanted to try something different because the Pacific Chai containers were always 3/4 full - it became annoying. But it turns out that some other brands are the same.
I love vanilla chai but I didn't prefer the Pacific vanilla chai because it wasn't spicy enough, and the same thing goes for Big Train Chai Vanilla - not spicy enough. I also did not like Mocafe Vanilla Chai.
I would love to find the perfect vanilla chai that has great spicy flavor.
The only coffee shop in town that carried Big Train vanilla chai stopped serving it. I ordered it and it was just as good as I remembered!

I know this product,so what I got from Amazon is the real thing.
I'm a new fan of Amazon, you can rely on their descriptions of the various products, at least that's what my experience has been so far.

column9: It's good.  Less "kick" than the vanilla chai at Dunkin Donuts.
column10: I ordered this product after I became addicted to the vanilla chai at Dunkin Donuts.  It's pretty good.  I was expecting a little bit more spice, but it's fine.  The chai at Dunkin Donuts is a little spicier than this one.  Since this was my first chia mix purchase I wasn't quite sure what to expect.  Next time I am going to order the spicy chai.
Great value!! Always get free shipping.... One can last me about a month. 1 scoop a day makes 1 cup, I like to add a little milk to mine! Very tasty, all that I share with ending loving as well!!
I have enjoyed this product very much and the price is great and the delivery is fast.

I bought this for my picky tea-and-hot-drink-loving-girlfriend last year for Christmas.

She's asking for it again this year, so it's definitely worth a try! They provide some helpful drink suggestions on the back, and I'm a big fan of it over ice.
This tastes much better than the "warm milk" you get from the various coffee houses like Starbucks.

column9: LOVE LoVe love my Big Train Chai!
column10: I owned a coffee shop for a time, and now that I no longer do, I gotta get my fix elsewhere. Amazon is way cheaper than going to a coffee shop and spending 5 times the money. Plus, I can make it the way I like it...thank you, Amazon, for such a great deal on the most delicious drink on Earth!

Big Train is the best instant chai! Make it with boiling hot water , stir it briskly and top it off with some cream or milk and it relaxes and calms you. Great when you want to unwind and have something  more substantial than just tea but not as rich as hot chocolate  and not as stimulating as coffee. Enjoy!
i can't keep enough of this in my kitchen...was signing on to order more and found the request to review product in mailbox...it is really terrific!!

Since this product is quite sugary, I use it for my coffee which not only makes the coffee taste better but I am using less than a scoop every time so it helps conserve.

The taste is smooth, creamy with a little kick.

Also, it comes with a scooper.

I will buy more of this when I run out.

I have tried a million variations of Chai - in my opinion, this is by far the best one. I am so addicted to it, I drink at least 1 cup a day. I should note that it's more on the sweet side and less on the spicy side, which not all people may like.

I was exposed to this chai at our local coffee shop, when he stopped carrying Big Train I tried the replacement brand and there was no comparison. Hands down I will continue to order this product and save a lot of money in the process! It is delicious and one of a kind.

column9: possibly the best tasting; definitely the best value.
column10:
in truth, this is the only kind i have ever purchased, so i can't make a fair comparison.

what i CAN say, however, is that even if you go to the manufacturer's website, this deal they have on amazon is a better deal pricewise PLUS it comes in the cans instead of the bags. PLUS each can comes with a scoop, so there is no need to measure anymore.

and lastly, there is the inclusion of the HOT CHAI LATTE Famous Barista Recipe. now in all truth, i have always said i was making myself a chai latte, when i wasn't. the barista recipe is the latte in that it adds the milk, which i never did.

so that's my take on this. i hope it helps you in your decision making.

column9: The best price in the market!
column10: I love Big Train Chai, however, it is so costly to purchase.  This is the best price I have ever seen and will definately be back to buy more!  Very fast shipment as well.  Thank you.

column9: It's delicious - as good as Dunkin Donuts
column10: Although the size of the can is deceiving (only about 3/5 full) the product is delicious and tastes equally as good as Dunkin' Donuts vanilla chai. I'll buy this again and again.

I ordered this flavor of Big Train (the product the coffee shops use) because I wanted more at a time. Unfortunately, it was only about 3/4's full, and did not, to me, taste like vanilla. Oddly enough, the smell reminds me of apples. ;^)
I am going back to buying the chocolate pouches of Big Train Chai.Big Train Chocolate Chai Mix, 12-Ounce Bags (Pack of 3)
This is the only brand of Chai tea that I like and the price is unbeatable!!

column9: Big Train has the best Chai!
column10: I used to work at a Border's Cafe...  Big Train was the chai they served and it is the best.  Border's Cafe's are no more.  They have all become Seattle's Best, but you can still get Big Train chai.  Amazon has a great price.  Blend it with ice, pour over ice, or serve hot.  It's delicious any way.

So it's Chai.  If you don't know Chai is a spiced tea.  In this case the overtone is vanilla.  It's got a little of everything you might get in pumpkin pie spice.  It's very tasty.  I use two scoops in a twice as large glass and I make it just with hot water.  You don't need to add milk.  Many of the local coffee bars actually use this brand.  You could of course make this whole thing yourself but this is a GREAT alternative. And of course Amazon is a great place to get it.  I actually love that they kind of remind me every couple of months to get more because I usually need it.

I love this stuff.  I have one of those small individual serving blenders and I love to make Vanilla Chai freezes.  I use ice and skim milk and this powder.  This brand is great, and you definitely get the most for your money.  I used to get Vanilla Chai freezes at Borders for like 3-4 dollars, Starbucks makes frozen Chai's for just under 5.  I've also tried Tastefully Simple Chai, but it was really really expensive.  It's nice to be able to make it at home whenever I want (which is basically every day!) and it's more cost effective.
Tastes amazingly great.  The vanilla flavor is definitely the best, and this chai is probably the best one out there, it comes out on top of my list.

column9: One of the best-tasting chai mixes out there!
column10: I've tried many different brands of chai over the years and Big Train's Vanilla Chai is one of the best out there.  My boyfriend loves it, too!  It's the only brand of chai that he'll drink.  Plus, you get so many servings for the price and free super saver shipping!  One of the gourmet food shops in the mall sells the small pouches of the same chai for $8 and there are only a few servings in the pouch.  It is definitely worth stocking up by buying the two can pack that's offered here!
This is the best.  Great taste and yummy, like eating dessert.  Love it.

After getting hooked on the Chai tea sold by Tastefully Simple (which is a little pricey), I decided to look online for something more affordable but still really good.  After reading the reviews on Amazon, I ordered this vanilla chai from Big Train and absolutely love it.  It has a great flavor (not too spicy but just enough).  I highly recommend it for its flavor as well as it's price.
this is the best tasting chai that i have found.  great value for this 2 pack of 1.9 cans.  i keep a can at work and one at home.  i am on my second order and will order again.
This stuff is amazing.  The most tasty Vanilla Chai I've ever encountered.  Used to drink it at a local coffee shop until I found out it could be purchased online.
THIS IS THE BEST CHAI TEA I HAVE EVER HAD.  I DO NOT LIKE SPICES IN MY CHAI TEA AND THIS ONE DOES NOT HAVE EXTRA SPICES IN IT.

My local coffee shop has me addicted to their 20 oz vanilla chai lattes. At $3.90 a pop I was spending a lot of money. I asked what brand they used, need nutritional information, of course! They told me it was Big Train Chai Vanilla.
It's important to follow the directions on the can. I made mine with just milk with a yucky result. Use the water with a little milk as there is milk powder in the mix.

WARNING:It's addicting!!!

I love hot chocolate, heck , I love chocolate period. I was a frequent fan of a certain book store that sounds like charms and local{hee hee} they use to serve there own brand of chai and then time stood still ... they stopped selling it. I called the store frantically to see if anyone could find some in a dusty old wharehouse in Cleveland...no really in Cleveland , Ohio that is where I discovered the yummy warm exotic substance.A very good sales rep informed me that Big Train Chai has the closest taste. So off in search of Big Train. I found it on Amazon and also at a wholesale club but I paid more at the wholesale club for just one can. On Amazon, I paid 19.99 for 2 cans AWESOME!! The flavor is creamy not like chai tea but like chai milk tea and it says to add one scoop per every 6 ounces but I use less for a larger cup. The warm cozy feeling I get is so pleasing it reminds me of the Big "O"{wink, wink}try  a cup, warning chai tea may frequent gas for some, and the caffine levels are probably much lower than tea, chocolate and obviously coffee.

Yes, this is delicious vanilla chai...the best I've tasted. However, the product description says "99% caffeine-free" and this simply can't be true. I ordered the single-serving packets of this product and the package clearly states the caffeine amount. Each serving actually contains 65mg of caffeine per serving. That's almost as much caffeine as a tall Starbucks espresso-based drink. Almost twice the amount of caffeine in a can of Coke!

If you need the caffeine boost, enjoy! But if you're watching your caffeine intake for whatever reason, be aware!

column9: Absolutely the best chai tea I've found
column10: After discovering chai tea a few years ago, I have since been hooked.  I have tried several coffee shop versions as well as a couple store bought varieties as well and can easily say this is my favorite chai tea.  The taste reminds me of that of a cinnamon roll with a very rich, smooth flavor.  Most other chai teas taste more like gingerbread to me, which while enjoyable, not my "cup of tea".  ;)  My only minor complaint would be that I usually end up with small amount of pulp in the last sip.  I'm not sure if this is due to the water not being hot enough but it's not enough to keep me from loving this product.

This is the same mix that my local coffee house uses in their latte's.  It's full of flavor and worth the price.  The only other Chai mix that  is better is Tastefully Simple's Oh My! Chai mix which is awesome!

I've been trying different brands of chai for a while.  My favorite been the Border's Cafe chai.  However, since Border's Cafe was phased out in favor of Seattle's Best Coffee I was back to square one.  Actually, this chai is so similar to the one sold at Border's Cafe, that I am pretty sure they were their supplier.  My search is over, I've found my chai !

I don't know why I didn't read the description more closely...this is just a sugar drink...argh! Why are people rating it so high???

Why don't these tea developers use Whey instead of sugar...it has way less useless calories...Oh, now who to give these two cans to without feeling guilty.

column9: Does not compare to Duncan Donuts
column10: I tried this to see if it would taste the same or close to Duncan Donuts & I'm sorry but it doesn't come close. At first it taste good but then there's some after taste.

This is delicious chai, one of the best you can buy to make at home. I always make it with milk, not water, and I use a Mr. Coffee Cocomotion ($20-$30)to heat and froth it up perfectly.  It is NOT a low sugar product, but I didn't expect it to be.

It's such a delicious treat! But don't put as much powder as the directions tell you to. You should use only about 1/2 of what's instructed or it's way to sweetand strong. It also won't desolve completely. But it really is wonderful once you get the correct measurements for your own taste!

I first tried this chai tea at a beach coffee shop while on vacation.  It was so good that I made my family go back to that location the next morning so I could find out what brand it was.  Big Train!!!  Now I'm hooked.

I have been ordering Big Train Vanilla and Spiced Chai for just over 2 years on Amazon's subscription. It was so good and it rivaled the chai at my favorite coffee house (NOT Char-bucks). I always LOVED it, and enjoyed a cup each morning as I braced for the coming day. I did, that is, up until several months ago. They seem to have changed the recipe because it just isn't the same.

Now I get a numbing sensation on my tongue when I drink it. If it sits for too long and sediment settles my reaction is really bad...I won't go into details. The taste is hard to describe, but it is kind of a detergent taste that burns. I even thought that I had detergent stuck in my mugs from the dishwasher, so I was very diligent in cleaning them before I made a cup. It didn't help.

The flavor was stronger with the spiced chai, so I started getting only vanilla. Unfortunately, I find the same unpleasant flavor with vanilla as well.

I have never used as much mix as the directions say because there was too much that settled out. Since this started happening, I have reduced the amount I use even more. That horrible flavor is still there, so I know it isn't related to the way it's mixed.

I am very disappointed because, like I said, it was my favorite beverage in the morning. After trying so many different things over the last 4 months, I have finally selected another brand to try out. I hope it is as good as this one used to be.

I bought this based on my liking chai tea and the other reviews. Although it is not caffeine free, (I am not sure why amazon has it listed as 99% caffeine free, because it says it contains 65mg per 8oz serving right on the can) it is very good and on a cold morning, it is great to sit and sip. Just boil some water and add a scoop to your cup, it is rich and satisfying! I offer this to all my guests and get great response! I have tried other brands and this is one of the best.

I have made Iced Chai Lattes with this mix for about five people now and they all LOVE it.  There are instructions on the side of the container that tell you how to do it.  It's very simple.  My only suggestions is this:  When it says to use 1 and 1/3 cups of powder, only use 1 cup.  It can be too sweet if you use the amounts they tell you to use.

column9: Great flavor and a great buy
column10:
You get to large cans of the powder. The flavor is rich and the best part is you can make it as sweet or as week as you like. One scoop per cup is usually plenty. I mix mine with a little milk to for a more creamy texture. I've tried a few other mixes and some have had a nasty smell and after taste. I used to buy the Target brand in the green can but they discontinued that and now make it in a silver can and its one of those fake chemical smelling and tasting mixes...YUK.

The only complaint about this is that 25% of the can is empty so you really don't get a full can. Other than that the flavor is great. Very close to the Duncan Donuts kind.
I ordered this brand when I couldn't find my usual brand. This is quite good, and has a smooth, cozy vanilla taste. Not real spicey, not too sweet...very good.

Saw this product online, looked over the reviews seemed favorable. I found this product to be extremely sweet; its main ingredient is sugar, it states that  right on the label. I wish was able to read the ingredients before I  purchased this product. I do not recommend this product to anyone who is trying to cut back on sugar in his or her diet.

My favorite coffee shop at college made the best Vanilla Chai.  I found out this is the brand they use, and now I can make it for myself.  I can't find it at any local grocery stores, so I'm so happy I can get it online.
This is a great tasting Chai Latte.  The price is much better than purchasing the smaller cans in the local stores.  I do however.... wish they would make one that is sugar and/or fat free.

I wish I knew the expiration date on this product before I bought it.  I don't drink this everyday so I will never finish the first can before the product expires.  Therefore I will have wasted my money since I will be throwing away one entire can plus the leftover from the first can.  It's such a shame.  I thought the price was a great deal but now I realize the seller probably wanted to get rid of them asap because of them expiring soon.
VERY GOOD  BUY TWO CANS EVERY MONTH - USED TO RUN OUT WHEN I HAD THE AUTOMATIC DELIVERY ONLY ONCE EVERY TWO MONTHS
I enjoyed this tea so much, I changed my subscription for receiving it from every 6 months to every 3 months.  Just like certain food is comfort food, this is a comfort drink.

I asked a barista at a local java shop what kind of Chai they had behind the counter. He said "Big Train", I've been buying it ever since. Easy to mix, GREAT hot or cold.
Vanilla > Spiced.

I had found a smaller packet of this in a store once and realized that I needed tubs of this stuff to fill my cravings.  And here are 2 cans of them for once nice price; one for home and one for work!  I have bought this twice because I love making my iced chai lattes every day.  That each can has its own scoop makes it even easier to make.
This stuff is so good my husband has to control himself from drinking it all day long (in which case it would be a LOT of calories).  So he now has one cup a day and absolutely loves it.
I absolutely love this brand of tea and will not buy any other type of chai. The pack of 2 is a great value for the price and is enough to last most tea drinkers a long time.

The Vanilla Chai is my favorite, makes a great iced chai on a hot summer day. I can't get it at the local coffee shops that used to carry it, so I was glad to find it here. I tend to want my chai drinks a little less sweet and strong, so making it myself lets me have it my way, and with this large can I can make whatever size I want at the time.
This is by far my favorite Chai.  I went through 2 cans all by myself last Spring, so ordered more!  Yum!

This Chai is perfect! A perfect blend of sweet and a little kick of spice. Some Chai teas are all spice no real flavor and some are just so mild. I love this so much, I have it on automatic re-order through Amazon every 2 months :)

This is by far my favorite chai. Big Train certainly knows what they're doing when it comes to a powdered beverage. Vanilla chai hits the spot, whether I make it hot or iced. My order has just arrived and I'm about to get into it now. I recommend you purchase this, you won't be let down.

This is the best vanilla chai you will ever have. we mix it up with milk and pour it over ice in the summer and have it warm like hot chocolate in the winter. absolutely perfect. the coffee shop down the street charges $4.50 for an iced vanilla chai made with this same mix. i'm saving a ton of money making it myself.

This stuff is great. I'm picky about chai flavor too. I was obsessed with getting these drinks at a coffee shop in FL for everrrr then found out what they use so I can just make my own (: It's really good blended with plain yogurt ice-cream and some milk. mmmmmm
this is the best chai out there!  I dont drink any other kind!  Makes a fabulous iced chai (especially with vanilla soy milk for th at extra vanilla kick)!!!  Service was also very quick.

Some years ago I was introduced to chai tea. I started drinking Tazo but then tried Big Train at Nordstroms. I was definitely love, at first taste!. I was buying it from that department store but it became too expensive. When I discovered it on Amazon and that I could order through subscribe and save, there was no more deciding. I also have my sister drinking it as well and she has an account established through me. As I stated it before, it's the best ever and I drink it everyday!!!
I am hooked with the Dunkin Donuts Chai and this one taste the same or even better...but u have to make it with only steamed milk only with one scoop..taste so creamy & yummy...
I have been buy this for along time. Love the it. It gets me going in the morning. Not a coffee drinker and this just hits the spot in the morning.

I am an avid tea drinker, hell, I even own a often visited tea reviewing blog. I am obsessed with chai tea.

That all being said, I was disappointed in the flavor of this chai tea. It honestly tastes like a hot chocolate with a tiny bit of spice added. I can taste a hint of clove, ginger and some cinnamon. The sugar in this mix is ridiculous. I tried to make it with half the directed amount and am left with little flavor, I tried to make it with double the amount and I am accosted with sweetness.

Maybe next time I will try the spicy chai by Big Train. If that's a bust, I will never try this brand again.

This is very delicious and easy to make!  It's good cold and hot.  I like to have it on the mornings I work early, because it helps to wake me up.  It is worth the money and i would deff recommend it!  (also, when you make it hot, adding half n' half makes it creamier)
I love this Chai Tea! It has such a great flavor and is easy to make. I have tried a number of other types of Chai Tea but this is by far my favorite.

Many years ago I tried my first Chai at Border's book store, they had their own brand and they even sold a tin of the powder, I loved it.  Then they quit making it.  I tried chai at all different kinds of coffee shops and cafes and did not like it.  I don't drink coffee or tea but I love a good, creamy chai.  I came across this chai and decided to try it.  It tastes almost exactly like the chai I used to love.  Now this is my favorite kind and I have it on autoship so I never run out.  I usually drink one mug a day.  I put almost 2 scoops, add a little almond milk...just enough to cover the powder, stir it up then add hot water.  It's my comfort drink.  I'm trying to wean off it because of all the sugar but it's so yummy it's hard to give up!  Maybe in the summer when it's hot I won't want it everyday.

The title for this review says it all - "Very Delicious." I first encountered this brand at a local coffee shop in my neighborhood. I like it so much I went ahead and purchased two canisters and a frother just to be able to have a Chai Tea Latte whenever I desired.

I discovered it's a challenge to find vanilla chai. Most chai teas out there seem to be "spicy." But this brand is really smooth and is a very nice blend of many flavors, in addition to the vanilla. It's not overwhelmed by the vanilla flavor though and does not taste artificial.

actually comparing this to a vanilla chai from dunkin donuts which i love, this holds up, depending on how you make it. if you want that warm creamy chai then you will have to add some milk when you put in the hot water but over all if you want that dunkin donuts chai and spend less this is worth getting.

I bought this for my girlfriend for her birthday. My girlfriend is VERY picky when it comes to food and drink choices and she couldn't be happier with Big Train Chai! She was first introduced to Big Train at a local coffee shop so I decided to buy her this to save cost and time. She actually makes her chai with cold milk and loves how easy it travels and stays fresh throughout the day. Her only complaint would be that the chai powder sometimes clumps because there is not hot liquid but it doesn't affect the taste. I would definitely recommend this product for any chai or coffee lover!

I started reading the reviews to find out if there is caffeine in the Vega Chai Vanilla.  Low and behold 65 mg per serving.  If you are sensitive to caffeine, beware.  I have yet to sleep and it is 3 am!

There's a Chai place I usually go to,  but that can get expensive so I started looking around for powders I could use at home.  I tried two other powders before this,  one from WalMart and one from Trader Joes,  can't remember the names,  but this one beats both.  It has a pleasant soft chai taste without being overly spiced or spicy.

column9: Tastes great, but full of caffeine and sugar
column10:
First, let me say that I LOVE the taste of this chai. It is my favorite chai and until I bought these two huge cans, it was something I enjoyed every couple of weeks when I was out shopping. Knowing how expensive it is to order from a coffee shop, I thought it would be better to just make it myself.

Making it at home, I use milk instead of water and only use about half of the recommended scoop.

Once I got the cans, I looked at the list of ingredients. Sugar is number one on the list and each serving has 24 grams of sugar in it. (That's almost 70% of each scoop.)

As others have mentioned, it definitely has caffeine in it. One 8 ounce cup of this prepared chai has about as much caffeine as two 12 ounce cans of Coke. After a short while, I noticed that the caffeine was starting to affect me- by way of headaches. I don't really understand the company's claim of being 99.8% caffeine free when clearly it is not.

While I think the flavor is great, I won't buy this again due to the caffeine and sugar content.
Of all the different types of Chai that I have tried this is by far my very favorite.  I have been ordering it for years and will continue to do so.

Like many others, I've been so addicted to Dunkin Donuts' Vanilla Chai. DD's Vanilla Chai is so incredibly delicious, it's almost too good to be true. I realized I have been spending a lot of money at DD for their Vanilla chai, and started to search online to see if there's anything that's as good. I found this, Big Train Vanilla Chai. It is good. It's very good. It doesn't taste exactly DD's, but it's pretty close. I make it with half water and half milk, it's amazing on a cold morning. I'd recommend it to everyone that also likes DD's Vanilla Chai. Although, I still miss DD's Vanilla Chai, for it's rich froth and creamier taste.

This is crack chai! Every time I go to a coffee spot, I hope they serve this. However, there is caffeine and it's mostly sugar. Understanding that, this is wonderful! Best taste. It's just the right amount of sweet for me without being overdone. I love how much money I've been saving making these in my own reusable to-go cups and can't wait to try out some recipes to vary it up a bit!

column9: Vanilla Chai by Big Train a morning treat !!
column10: Vanilla Chai by Big Train starts my day with a treat, a piece of fruit and a danish and I am ready to go !!
I received this product as a gift a long time ago.  I recently was reminded about ths product and decided to purchase some in hopes it was still good.  It did not disappoint.  Big Train is delicious!

column9: Quick delivery! This Chai is my favourite :)
column10:
This Vanilla Chai is unfortunately not easy to find at the grocery store. Glad amazon offers it!
Fitz Che valerie

column9: Tasty as hell!! and i cant get enough
column10: I really enjoy this instant chai mix and there is so much of it.. most likely going to buy more when im out...that will be some time from now though....(later) bought more...love this stuff!
This  is by far the best tasting chai tea on the market. It's creamy and smooth without the bitter spicy after tast that other chai teas have! I Love this stuff!!!

column9: Best chai tea by far bar none!!
column10: Been drinking this for years now, even my sons (who are neither tea nor coffee drinkers both enjoy this as well. Great flavor, always fresh. Love the vanilla. Tried many around the world through the last 10 years, this is the BEST by far.

This is a wonderful powdered chai mix. It is mixed with hot water, can be iced, can have milk added. A local shop here served it and sold it for home use. I really like it.

That said, I subtracted a star because of the "99% caffeine free" statement in the product listing. While it may be technically correct (I'm not sure how I'd calculate whether the can contains only 1% caffeine, and whether by weight or volume), I think it is misleading. I use caffeinated products, but seek decaf for my son. I do not feel that 65mg of caffeine per serving counts as "caffeine free," and would suggest that this part of the product description should be amended or removed.

Meanwhile, I see that at least one other reviewer has noted the caffeine issue, and I will call attention to it, as well. Still great tasting chai mix, would just like to see an improved product description rather than a misleading statement and a legal disclaimer.
Got this for my wife and she liked it a lot . I will buy this again very good product.

I'm a big fan of Dunkin Donuts vanilla chai so I was spending a fortune getting at least one a day. This chai mix is a very nice substitute once you fiddle with the directions a bit to make it to your individual taste (e.g. made with 1/2 water and 1/2 milk).I also find it especially appealing when it's made in a hot cocoa machine...comes out hot and frothy.

Previously purchased this in a gourmet shop. I was instructed to use water, however, once I arrived home, I made it with milk. I used one scoop and a battery operated mixer which gave it a lovely froth. This is a wonderful product, especially on a chilly night. Exceptional value purchasing 2 cans. Even my neighbor is hooked. She used to go to Dunkin Doughnuts but now she just mixes it herself, and did I mention the money she is saving by not Big Train Vanilla Chai, 1.9-Pound Cans (Pack of 2)going out.

This is my favorite Chai; I drink it almost every day at work, and the flavor is great. The big tin in nice and includes a perfect-sized scoop to make a cup. It's nice to have a tin instead of individual packets, so you can add/reduce the amount of powder according to your preference. The perfect morning or afternoon treat!
I buy this every winter as a little treat to myself.  I like it with just hot water, but I recently started adding it to my coffee instead of creamer.  I love it!

I love Big Train Chai Tea, it is the best! I am not a coffee drinker so I always order chai when out! There is a wide spectrum in the world of chai and by far this is the best! It is more like a latte and tastes oh so good! Love it so much, Big Train Chai is one of my auto shipments from Amazon!!

column9: tasty chai from the coffee shop
column10: I love this brand of chai, they used to use it at a local coffee shop where I worked as a barista when I was younger and I have never forgotten it. I order it now to save on coffee shop prices. It is a bit tricky to get the mix to fully dissolve, but works fine if you start with a few ml's of hot water.
Wasn't a warm tea drinker until I discovered Big Train Chai.  Now I can't get enough of it.  The spice and chocalate chais are great too. Also, the 1.9 pound canisters are very convenient.

This is a delicious, warm drink for a nice cool morning.  It comes packaged in 2 cans and is much less expensive than at a grocery store. Inside is a scooper for your measurement.  You will love this chai!

I used to buy Big Train Vanilla Chai all the time from a local coffee shop when I lived in the mountains of North Carolina. However, after I moved I could not find anything that compared to it. All the usual chain coffee shops just couldn't match their quality. So I decided to start buying my own. If I am using a cup that holds 12 oz of liquid, I usually heat 6 oz of water, 6 oz of milk, and add 2 scoops of chai for an excellent combination.
Big Train Vanilla Chai is very good, mixes great unlike other instant chai's I have tried hot or cold!  I order every other month! Fast, reliable shipping!

I had this chai tea at a local restaurant and loved it.  After searching all over for it I finally found it here at Amazon and was quite pleased. Though I think it is a little expensive, I haven't found any quite as rich and satisfying.  One caution is that it's fairly sweet and higher in calories and saturated fat than I wish it was, but the taste makes up for it.

For some reason here in NJ i cannot find anywhere that sells vanilla chai, except for Dunkin Donuts! In CA you can find this stuff in nearly any supermarket. Great price, @ around $10 a can, and they are huge cans. Very happy with purchase will be buying more when this lot runs out.

When in N.Y. visiting my sister she introduced me to amazon vanilla chi tea. We would have a cup every night before bed. It would be a relaxing time enjoying a good cup of tea and conversation. It is delivered to her door every couple months. Now I am back in Ks and have ordered it to be delivered on a regular schedule. Miss my sister and the conversation though.

column9: Great taste, gerat value...better than Starbuck's.
column10: Big Train Vanilla Chai is absoulutly amazing. I never hesitate when it comes to buying this for my wife and I. As my description says, it is better than Starbuck's Vanilla chai by a long shot. I am planning to get a coffee/expresso machine that also has a steamer built on becuase that is how our local coffee shop makes this with milk, and that is how it taste's the best. This is a great value as well! this last us for a very long time, and the money is well worth it, considering it cost you $3-$5 for a single cup of this at your local shop. it taste great, and for the coffee shop fell, just add some ready whip or Zip Whip to the top and your good to go. Great Taste, Great value!
This Chai tea, is a big hit here at work. I brought it in and everyone that has had it raves about it. It has a nice soothing buttery taste that has been a hit here in this work enviroment.

is tasty chai tea.  also good for camping, because you only have to add water to the mix.  I was buying this for 8.99 for the 12oz packages (i think that's what the baggies weigh), but this is much better deal, 2 1.9lb cans for 20 bucks, free shipping.  thanks!
This vanilla Chai is not spicy - like the liquid type from Starbucks. It is delicious and when made with lowfat milk and a frother - it tastes just like it is from a coffee shop.
Ordered this online as a gift for my husband since he drinks a lot at a local coffee shop in an attempt to save some money.  It's absolutely wonderful and so easy to make.  Saves us a ton of money!
I love chai tea in the mornings and this is good stuff.  I used the International mix before but this is just a good for a lot better price.

I am writing on behalf of my husband who tried a sample pack of this chai and dubbed it, "The best chai I've ever had.  Can you find me more?"  Boy did I ever and he is thrilled.  We also sent some as a gift to friends of ours and they love it too.  Love that you can get the extra discount for consistent delivery.

My cousin has been drinking the "Spiced Chai Tea" for months now and it's pretty tastey, but I wanted to try the Vanilla because I prefer a smoother tasting tea. And let me just say... I am sooo happy that I decided to purchase the "Vanilla Chai Tea." It's delicious with warm water, but if you want a creamier taste try it with milk. When I was developing a slight cold I mixed one scoop of the tea, 7oz. of hot water, 1 tsp of honey, and 1.5oz of Remy Martin 1738 Cognac and it was heaven in a coffee mug :o). I can honestly say that I am addicted to this stuff and I'm not ashamed to admit it. If your a "Calorie Counter," BEWARE of this tea - it's hard to have just one cup a day!1!
This is hands down the best Chai that I have ever tasted.  It has a rich creamy vanilla taste that satisfys every time.
This is awesome Chai, just like getting it from the coffee shop! It is easy to make it hot or cold, only takes a minute or two.

So good; this is the chai that a lot of coffee shops sell.  Good price too.  It's a mellow chai; I guess the vanilla mellows it out, and it's a powder, so it won't taste anything like chai tea leaves, but it's quite good.  I have a cup about 5 days a week.

This is the best Chai Tea available! So much better than spending WAY too much money on mediocre chai tea at a Starbucks, etc. And you can enjoy a cup any time of the day! Have gotten lots of people hooked on it and even have "Tea time" at work! Enjoy!

Wow!  I had this at Nordstrom cafe and had to find out the brand.  Thank God I found it on here.  This is the absolute best Chai tea I have ever had.  If you like Vanilla Chai - hot or cold,then you have to buy this. You will not be disappointed!

I think this is the best one on the Market for at home. If you like Dunkin Donuts at the drive-thru, this is the closest thing you're gonna get at home. I consider myself a Chai Drinker I buy at least 4 at Dunkin Donuts and have at least 4 of these Big Train Chai's at home a day. The only suggestion..... I make is make it with milk, it is awesome that way. I haven't seen this yet at any donut or coffee shops yet. Does anyone know who serves it?
Love this drink mix.  I make it with hot vanilla soy milk and water.  I probably need an intervention.  The best one I have found and I have tried many.

I had tasted this chai at a nearby coffee shop, and had to have it. I didn't know the brand they were using, but one of the employees (THANK YOU SO MUCH), shared it with me. There has not been a single person i've served this to, that has not appreciated it's rich and delicate taste... it really as amazing! :-)

I've been buying Big Train Vanilla Chai since 2002-2003ish, and it is by far my favorite chai that I have found. The taste and texture is smooth, and flavorful... I tend to like my chai rich, so I mix it with milk instead of water. I also like to add BT to my coffee (with a touch of milk) when I'm in the mood for sweet pick-me-up :) My husband likes to mix Big Train Vanilla Chai mix in his Tazo Chai tea for a little extra spice once in a while, but he does like BT all on it's own. It's always a big hit with company too. :)

I purchase Chai Tea every year about this time...it is my comfort food...I also like to give it as gifts at Christmas, everyone loves it! I have tried the spice also, but I keep coming back to the vanilla...both are great, and Big Train is the BEST!

column9: I am a chai tea latte fanatic!
column10: This is the best vanilla chai tea. It is a really good value, you get 2 large cans for a good price, especially if you add a little something else to your order and get free shipping.
A pretty good mix, I just don't like that it has so much sugar in it, but that is just me. Taste pretty good for an occasional treat.

It's official. I'm addicted to Big Train Chai!!! I know every coffee stand in my city that uses this product! It's the best tasting chai EVER!!! I always order it on amazon, and when I run out BOY does it get expensive paying $4 per smoothie at a coffee stand! Get this, you'll LOVE it! If you ever order chai at java crew, this is the same chai they use!!! way more economical to buy your own tubs! YUM!

I find this to be the best Chai mix.  It is smooth and creamy even when made with water.  It also works well iced, which I recently discovered this summer.  I have heard mixed things on the caffeine content, but I'll go with the labeling and trust it is 99% caffeine free.  With subscribe and save, you can't beat the price, either.
These were just ok.  They were perfect for my strawberry shortcake party for my daughters 1st birthday but the favor wasn't that great.

These tasted SO artifical & funky! And now I'm stuck with 9 lbs of them. I tried strawberry banana rings at a local frozen yogurt shop that were delish & found this great deal & ordered assuming they'd taste the same. Boy was I wrong. These are gross!!!!

I grew up eating these extraordinary brandy-filled chocolates. (Ok, I admit, I didn't actually eat them as a small child), but still, these wonderful treats bring back some very happy memories. The chocolate is very dark and silky, and the brandy fills your mouth with flavor. (It's quite a shock to those who haven't experienced these chocolates before). If you're looking for a great gift for someone who appreciates fine chocolate and brandy, look no further.

I lived in Germany for almost 20 years, I absolutely fell in love with the Asbach filled candies, they are the very, very best anywhere in the world. I would Highly Recommend them and know you'll really love them. There are look-alikes on the market, but NONE as great as these.

I so looked forward to Christmas every year, my grandmother lived in Germany and my brother and I would get a package from her with Asbach Uralt candies in it.  She would always send it to his house and when we received it he would call and tease me that he was enjoying my portion of the chocolates.  Unfortunately my grandmother passed away and the yearly packages stopped.  But then came along the internet and I was able to find these candies and have them shipped!  I was so excited when I received the chocolates the first year I ordered them, I could not wait until Christmas eve to surprise my brother with these, it was a big hit!  It doesn't matter what else I get him every year as long as I carry on the tradition of giving him Asbach Uralt Brandy chocolate!
All i can say is Yummy for my tummy! The whole transaction from beginning to end was a splendid experince. Thank you.

This package(s) contain a great assortment of Mars mini bars. There are snickers, milky way, musketeer, dark milky way, and twixt minis in the package.  There is something for everyone's taste preference. Great snack food for the grandkids when they visit and these also freeze well for future snacks. I highly recommend this product.

column9: Nutricity is the VERY WORST EVER place to order from
column10: Nutricity is the very worst ever place to order. I ordered almond butter thinking it came in a glass bottle and when I received it it was packages in plastic. I returned them and they send me an email saying they did not receive returns. When I tried to get in touch with them with their 800 number a recording said they only handle returns via email. I will never ever order from them. I highly recommend that nobody ever orders from them. When I ordered I never read that you couldn't return an item. And then to top it off I could not talk to anyone in their company they handle all via email. VERY DISSAPOINTING! DO NOT ORDER ANYTHING FROM THEM.

Didn't really know what to expect. All the boxes were
in a convenient size and all the crackers stayed fresh, even being opened
for a bit. I'd buy these again.

I love these crackers.. They are delicious, buttery tasting and go well with any kind of toppings.. They are great for parties or just to munch on while watching TV.. The only thing I didn't care for were the Sesame ones, but that's just me, I don't care for them but my friends and family adored them.. We all really enjoyed them and I will be purchasing more..
I got these wholesale for $6 or so, and my roommate and I have been gnawin' on them for over a month.

The mix was enough to make about 10, 20 oz hurricanes.  The instructions were good and the drink turned out very tasty and was almost as easy to make as buying a hurricane at Pat O'Briens.  The only thing I did differently when I made them a second time was to add more water to the mix so it was less concentrated, but you can easily adjust the strength for your own tastebuds.  Enjoy!

column9: Do Not Order From Pickled Pantry
column10: I am the C.E.O. and Co-Founder of Sprout Foods, Inc. and Pickled Pantry is illegally selling our products online. They are also price gouging you at $3 per pouch. Our products are sold in the marketplace anywhere from $0.99 to $1.39 depending on the retailer. Please do not waste your money buying from Pickled Pantry. I am working to have them removed from Amazon.

My baby loves this food: I've tasted it myself, and it has a very nice flavor. I love that it is made with brown rice instead of white rice for better nutrition. I prefer to make my own food, but this is really nice as a back up when things get busy or for travel.

I tried this baby food several times, even though it it recommended 7 months & older, my 10 month old baby is not able to handle this food.
She's able to "chew" other, more textured baby food, but this just makes her throw up (literally...unfortunately)!
It has a very weird texture, that I've never seen before in any baby food (organic or not)!
Even warming it up or mixing it with fruit only food did not help, it looks like it is not "moist" enough.
I can't recommend to buy this food, we didn't have the problem with organic baby food of other brands.
My show/working dog loves this stuff. It is a great product, healthy, easy to prepare, store, and by the way he eats it.... it must taste good too.

I rescued a 3 year old Doberman Lily a few months ago who was not in the best of health, and after getting a checkup at the Vet, I found out that she has heartworms.  After all the shots she just received, she had to go through a lengthy treatment with more medications than I would ever want to give my dog, but I had no choice.
